Anchor values are not sent to the server: Anchor values are not sent to the server and cannot be redirected.

If that did not help then {{strong}}crea: If that did not help then {{strong}}create an issue{{/strong}} or send it in an {{strong}}email{{/strong}}.
If that doesn't help, open your browser': If that doesn't help, open your browser's error console and create a {{link}}new issue{{/link}} with the details.

If this is not expected then this {{supp: If this is not expected then this {{support}}support page{{/support}} may help.
If you are using WordPress 5.2 or newer: If you are using WordPress 5.2 or newer then look at your {{link}}Site Health{{/link}} and resolve any issues.

If you are using a page caching plugin o: If you are using a page caching plugin or service (CloudFlare, OVH, etc) then you can also try clearing that cache.
If you change the permalink in a post or: If you change the permalink in a post or page then Redirection can automatically create a redirect for you.
If you do experience a problem then plea: If you do experience a problem then please consult your plugin documentation, or try contacting your host support. This is generally {{link}}not a problem caused by Redirection{{/link}}.
If you do not complete the manual instal: If you do not complete the manual install you will be returned here.
If you want to redirect everything pleas: If you want to redirect everything please use a site relocation or alias from the Site page.
If you want to report a bug please read: If you want to report a bug please read the {{report}}Reporting Bugs{{/report}} guide.
If you want to submit information that y: If you want to submit information that you don't want in a public repository then send it directly via {{email}}email{{/email}} - include as much information as you can!
If you want to {{support}}ask for suppor: If you want to {{support}}ask for support{{/support}} please include these details:
If your browser is behaving differently: If your browser is behaving differently then you should clear your browser cache.
If your site needs special database perm: If your site needs special database permissions, or you would rather do it yourself, you can manually run the following SQL.

Importing existing redirects from WordPr: Importing existing redirects from WordPress or other plugins is a good way to get started with Redirection. Check each set of redirects you wish to import.
Include these details in your report alo: Include these details in your report along with a description of what you were doing and a screenshot.
Keep a log of all redirects and 404 erro: Conserver un journal de toutes les redirections et erreurs 404.
Leaving before the process has completed: Quitter avant la fin du processus peut causer des problÃ¨mes.
Log \"external\" redirects - those not f: Log "external" redirects - those not from Redirection. This can increase your log size and contains no user information.
Log out, clear your browser cache, and l: Log out, clear your browser cache, and log in again - your browser has cached an old session.
Match against this browser referrer text: Match against this browser referrer text
Match against this browser user agent: Match against this browser user agent

More powerful URL matching, including {{: More powerful URL matching, including {{regular}}regular expressions{{/regular}}, and {{other}}other conditions{{/other}}

Note: this is in beta and will only migr: Note: this is in beta and will only migrate posts. Certain permalinks will not work. If yours does not work then you will need to wait until it is out of beta.
Once deleted your redirections will stop: Once deleted your redirections will stop working. If they appear to continue working then please clear your browser cache.

Please check the {{link}}support site{{/: Please check the {{link}}support site{{/link}} before proceeding further.
Please clear your browser cache and relo: Please clear your browser cache and reload this page.
Please do not try and redirect all your: Please do not try and redirect all your 404s - this is not a good thing to do.
Please note that any support is provide: Please note that any support is provide on as-time-is-available basis and is not guaranteed. I do not provide paid support.
Please remain on this page until complet: Veuillez rester sur cette page jusqu'Ã  la fin.
Please review your data and try again.
Please take a moment to consult the {{su: Please take a moment to consult the {{support}}support site{{/support}} for information about how to use Redirection.
Read this REST API guide for more inform: Read this REST API guide for more information.
Redirected by an unknown agent. {{suppor: Redirected by an unknown agent. {{support}}What does this mean?{{/support}}.
Redirection communicates with WordPress: Redirection communicates with WordPress through the WordPress REST API. This is a standard part of WordPress, and you will experience problems if you cannot use it.
Redirection is designed to be used on si: Redirection is designed to be used on sites with a few redirects to sites with thousands of redirects.
Redirection is free to use - life is won: Redirection is free to use - life is wonderful and lovely! It has required a great deal of time and effort to develop and you can help support this development by {{strong}}making a small donation{{/strong}}.
Redirection is not working. Try clearing: Redirection is not working. Try clearing your browser cache and reloading this page.
Redirection stores no user identifiable: Redirection stores no user identifiable information other than what is configured above. It is your responsibility to ensure your site meets any applicable {{link}}privacy requirements{{/link}}.
Redirection uses the {{link}}WordPress R: Redirection uses the {{link}}WordPress REST API{{/link}} to communicate with WordPress. This is enabled and working by default. Sometimes the REST API is blocked by:
Redirects added to an Apache group can b: Redirects added to an Apache group can be saved to an {{code}}.htaccess{{/code}} file by adding the full path here. For reference, your WordPress is installed to {{code}}%(installed)s{{/code}}.
Reload the page - your current session i: Reload the page - your current session is old.
Remember to enable the \"regex\" option: Remember to enable the "regex" option if this is a regular expression.
Selecting this option will delete all re: Selecting this option will delete all redirections, all logs, and any options associated with the Redirection plugin.  Make sure this is what you want to do.
Sign up for the tiny Redirection newslet: Sign up for the tiny Redirection newsletter - a low volume newsletter about new features and changes to the plugin. Ideal if you want to test beta changes before release.
Site headers are added across your site,: Site headers are added across your site, including redirects. Redirect headers are only added to redirects.
Some features you may find useful are: Some features you may find useful are
Some other plugin that blocks the REST A: Some other plugin that blocks the REST API
Some servers may be configured to serve: Some servers may be configured to serve file resources directly, preventing a redirect occurring.
Something is wrong with the server. This: Something is wrong with the server. This is not a problem with Redirection and you will need to resolve the error yourself.
Something went wrong obtaining this info: Something went wrong obtaining this information
Something went wrong obtaining this information. It may work in the future.
Something went wrong when installing Red: Something went wrong when installing Redirection.
Sometimes your browser can cache a URL,: Sometimes your browser can cache a URL, making it hard to know if it's working as expected. Use this service from {{link}}redirect.li{{/link}} to get accurate results.
Sorry, something went wrong loading the: Sorry, something went wrong loading the data - please try again
Store IP information for redirects and 4: Stocker les informations IP pour les redirections et erreurs 404.
Storing logs for redirects and 404s will: Storing logs for redirects and 404s will allow you to see what is happening on your site. This will increase your database storage requirements.
Storing the IP address allows you to per: Storing the IP address allows you to perform additional log actions. Note that you will need to adhere to local laws regarding the collection of data (for example GDPR).
Take a look at the {{link}}plugin status: Take a look at the {{link}}plugin status{{/link}}. It may be able to identify and "magic fix" the problem.

The caret {{code}}^{{/code}} should be a: The caret {{code}}^{{/code}} should be at the start. For example: {{code}}%(example)s{{/code}}
The companion plugin Search Regex allows: The companion plugin Search Regex allows you to search and replace data on your site. It also supports Redirection, and is handy if you want to bulk update a lot of redirects.

The following redirect plugins were dete: The following redirect plugins were detected on your site and can be imported from.

The source URL should probably start wit: The source URL should probably start with a {{code}}/{{/code}}

There are some problems connecting to yo: There are some problems connecting to your REST API. It is not necessary to fix these problems and the plugin is able to work.
There was a problem making a request to: There was a problem making a request to your site. This could indicate you provided data that did not match requirements, or that the plugin sent a bad request.
These are some options you may want to e: Voici quelques options que vous pouvez activer maintenant. Elles peuvent Ãªtre modifiÃ©es Ã  tout moment.
This could be a security plugin, or your: This could be a security plugin, or your server is out of memory or has an external error. Please check your server error log
This information is provided for debuggi: This information is provided for debugging purposes. Be careful making any changes.
This is an IP from a private network. Th: This is an IP from a private network. This means it is located inside a home or business network and no more information can be displayed.
This is usually fixed by doing one of th: This is usually fixed by doing one of the following:
This will be converted to a server redir: This will be converted to a server redirect for the domain {{code}}%(server)s{{/code}}.
Title: Titre
To match {{code}}?{{/code}} you need to: To match {{code}}?{{/code}} you need to escape it with {{code}}\\?{{/code}}
To prevent a greedy regular expression y: To prevent a greedy regular expression you can use {{code}}^{{/code}} to anchor it to the start of the URL. For example: {{code}}%(example)s{{/code}}
Track redirect hits and date of last acc: Track redirect hits and date of last access. Contains no user information.
Unable to check that URL. It may not be: Unable to check that URL. It may not be valid or accessible.
Unable to make request due to browser se: Unable to make request due to browser security. This is typically because your WordPress and Site URL settings are inconsistent, or the request was blocked by your site CORS policy.
Use groups to organise your redirects. G: Utilisez les groupes pour organiser vos redirections. Les groupes sont assignÃ©s Ã  un module, ce qui affecte le fonctionnement des redirections dans ce groupe. Si vous n'Ãªtes pas sÃ»r, utilisez le module WordPress.
Used to auto-generate a URL if no URL is: Used to auto-generate a URL if no URL is given. Use the special tags {{code}}\$dec\${{/code}} or {{code}}\$hex\${{/code}} to insert a unique ID instead
Version %s installed! Please read the {{: Version %s installed! Please read the {{url}}release notes{{/url}} for details.
Want to keep up to date with changes to: Want to keep up to date with changes to Redirection?
Want to redirect the entire site? Enter: Want to redirect the entire site? Enter a domain to redirect everything, except WordPress login and admin. Enabling this option will disable any site aliases or canonical settings.
Wildcards are not supported. You need to: Wildcards are not supported. You need to use a {{link}}regular expression{{/link}}.
WordPress automatically creates redirect: WordPress automatically creates redirects when you change a post URL. Importing these into Redirection will allow you to manage and monitor them.
WordPress did not return a response. Thi: WordPress did not return a response. This could mean an error occurred or that the request was blocked. Please check your server error_log.
WordPress returned an unexpected message: WordPress returned an unexpected message. This could be a PHP error from another plugin, or data inserted by your theme.
You are using an old or cached session: You are using an old or cached session
You get useful software and I get to car: You get useful software and I get to carry on making it better.
You have different URLs configured on yo: You have different URLs configured on your WordPress Settings > General page, which is usually an indication of a misconfiguration, and it can cause problems with the REST API. Please review your settings.
You should update your site URL to match: You should update your site URL to match your canonical settings: {{code}}%(current)s{{/code}} â‡’ {{code}}%(site)s{{/code}}
You will need at least one working REST: You will need at least one working REST API to continue.
You will need to configure your system (: You will need to configure your system (DNS and server) to pass requests for these domains to this WordPress install.
You will will need to fix this on your s: You will will need to fix this on your site. Redirection is not causing the error.
You've supported this plugin - thank you: You've supported this plugin - thank you!
Your REST API appears to be cached and t: Your REST API appears to be cached and this will cause problems. Please exclude your REST API from your caching system.
Your REST API is being redirected. Pleas: Your REST API is being redirected. Please remove the redirection for the API.
Your REST API is not working and the plu: Your REST API is not working and the plugin will not be able to continue until this is fixed.
Your REST API is probably being blocked: Your REST API is probably being blocked by a security plugin. Please disable this, or configure it to allow REST API requests.
Your REST API is showing a deprecated PH: Your REST API is showing a deprecated PHP error. Please fix this error.
Your URL appears to contain a domain ins: Your URL appears to contain a domain inside the path: {{code}}%(relative)s{{/code}}. Did you mean to use {{code}}%(absolute)s{{/code}} instead?
Your WordPress REST API has been disable: Your WordPress REST API has been disabled. You will need to enable it to continue.
Your WordPress REST API is returning a 4: Your WordPress REST API is returning a 404 page. This is almost certainly an external plugin or server configuration issue.
Your admin pages are being cached. Clear: Your admin pages are being cached. Clear this cache and try again. There may be multiple caches involved.
Your server configuration is blocking ac: Your server configuration is blocking access to the REST API.
Your server has rejected the request for: Your server has rejected the request for being too big. You will need to reconfigure it to continue.
Your source is the same as a target and: Your source is the same as a target and this will create a loop. Leave a target blank if you do not want to take action.
Your target URL contains the invalid cha: Your target URL contains the invalid character {{code}}%(invalid)s{{/code}}
Your target URL should be an absolute UR: Your target URL should be an absolute URL like {{code}}https://domain.com/%(url)s{{/code}} or start with a slash {{code}}/%(url)s{{/code}}.
{{link}}Caching software{{/link}}, in pa: {{link}}Caching software{{/link}}, in particular Cloudflare, can cache the wrong thing. Try clearing all your caches.
{{link}}Import{{/link}} from .htaccess,: {{link}}Import{{/link}} from .htaccess, CSV, and a variety of other plugins
{{link}}Monitor 404 errors{{/link}}, get: {{link}}Monitor 404 errors{{/link}}, get detailed information about the visitor, and fix any problems
{{link}}Please temporarily disable other: {{link}}Please temporarily disable other plugins!{{/link}} This fixes so many problems.
{{strong}}CSV file format{{/strong}}: {{: {{strong}}CSV file format{{/strong}}: {{code}}source URL, target URL{{/code}} - and can be optionally followed with {{code}}regex, http code{{/code}} ({{code}}regex{{/code}} - 0 for no, 1 for yes).
{{strong}}Warning{{/strong}}: ensure you: {{strong}}Warning{{/strong}}: ensure your HTTPS is working before forcing a redirect.
